author: slava77
body:
backport of #24818

copy-paste of the description in 104X follows:

This PR is somewhat inspired by issues reported in https://hypernews.cern.ch/HyperNews/CMS/get/tier0-Ops/2014.html

The target module(s) in this PR are of HitPairEDProducer kind.
To define a limit I used a somewhat ad-hoc limit of \~0.5 GB of output data per event.
This leads to 
- a limit of 50M pairs for produceIntermediateHitDoublets = True (producing 2 ints per entry)
- a limit of 12M pairs for produceSeedingHitSets = True (producing 4 rechit pointers per entry)

As a specific case test, I used PromptReco_Run323420_EGamma from the HN thread and find that with this PR the job is expected to be processable:
- single thread RSS peak moves down from 22GB to 7GB
    - 8-thread RSS peak with this PR is around 13GB

Note that I made a guess for a bottom-up limit: for 10K real particles in an event (PU200 has about 10K tracking particles with pt>0.5 GeV and |eta|<4), for at worst \~50 layer pairs (as a still sensible large number)
- 12M limit would correspond to \~4% purity in created pairs
- 50M limit would correspond to \~1% purity in created pairs

This sounds safe enough from these "first principles".
title: (re)introduce hit pair limit in iterative tracking seeding (port of #24818 )
